page.title: 06Farming,Cereal Production
page.content: Wheat is produced for animal feed and human consumption.Barley is grown for cattle and pig feed and used for low grade malt.Both are sown in Autumn using minimum cultivation methods-that is the land is 'scratched' at the surface or scuffled and then sown by conventional drills,with the exception of the outgoing Rape crop after which the land is ploughed.Hence each area is ploughed every 5 years.Wheat is drilled as long as weather permits,then the remaining land is given over to Spring Barley.Three different varieties of Wheat are used in consecutive years to avoid disease for which fungicide is used.Some crops are aerial sprayed when tractor spraying would damage the Wheat.Herbicides are used to control wild oats and black grass.
